item.title: Parkinson's Law: Getting more things done, fast!
item.description: Hero image by Nathan Dumlao on Unsplash Planning the timeline for a project is one of the hardest things to do. You might have years of experience, but you might still not get it correct. However, with experience, you do get very close to the exact turnaround time. Then, you realize that the best you can do is make the roadmap more adaptable to change. The reason it's so hard is, the roadmap of any project has so many undefined and unpredictable variables that you can never be sure about it.
